title: Guillermo Del Toro Reviles AI Accepting ‘Frankenstein’ Tribute At Gotham Awards
description: Guillermo del Toro left no doubt about his feelings for artificial intelligence, saying ‘F—k AI” at the Gotham Awards as he received a Tribute for 'Frankenstein'.

title: UPDATE 1-South Korea's Lee calls for tougher penalties after Coupang data breach
description: South Korean police have launched an investigation into the leak of personal information of more than 33 million customers of the country's largest e-commerce platform that has rapidly expanded its customer base and is branching into new services. "The wrong practice and the idea of not giving necessary care for personal data protection, which is a key asset in the age of artificial intelligence and digitalization, must be completely changed," Lee said.
content:
South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Tuesday the massive customer data leak from e-commerce platform Coupang is a wake-up call for stronger protection of digital privacy and ordered plans to raise fines and penalties for such lapses.
Lee said... [1403 chars]

title: Central Pa. residents tepid on construction of data centers in the region: poll
description: A third of Pa. residents said in a new poll that artificial intelligence poses a "significant threat" to humanity.
content:
A third of Pennsylvanians surveyed said artificial intelligence poses a “significant threat” to humanity, while nearly half said AI development will have a negative impact on the economy.

title: Apple AI chief to retire as former Microsoft exec takes over
description: Apple's artificial intelligence chief John Giannandrea will retire, the company announced Monday in an AI leadership shakeup following Siri delays.

title: Australia rolls out AI roadmap, steps back from tougher rules
description: SYDNEY, Dec 2 (Reuters) - Australia on Tuesday unveiled a roadmap to ramp up the adoption of artificial intelligence across its economy but said it would rely on existing laws to manage emerging risks, stepping back from earlier plans for tougher rules on high-risk scenarios.
